instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has backlight but no image
threads.message:
small amounts of liquid damage in multiple areas. There is USB activity, chime is there, fans spin up when battery is disconnected as if it's booting. backlight is there. Tested with known good screen, nothing but backlight.

Also it doesn't seem to turn off backlight if I close the lid. So perhaps has to do with SMC lid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has backlight but no image
threads.message:
Backlight present with black, or white screen?
Just in case, check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level, when lid close/open.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has backlight but no image
threads.message:
sorry im wrong, lid is behaving, I think the IO board wasn't in properly 

But screen is black with backlight 
makes dong, seems like it starts too

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has backlight but no image
threads.message:
Check all caps and resistors related with J8300.
Be sure to have good solders and traces.
You may need to change video connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has backlight but no image
threads.message: hmm, they all check out perfectly, even checked diode mode on pins with known good board. I see that come components there communicate directly with SMC, do you think SMC can cause no image? there was corrosion on the <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> test point near the SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has backlight but no image
threads.message: Video connector is pristine. No liquid damage near it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has backlight but no image
threads.message:
If you get backlight, PCH should be recognizing the LCD.
Just in case, check voltage on pins 14 and 18/19 of J8300.

You may have a communication problem on the I2C bus; check <RESISTOR>R8361</RESISTOR>-64 and diode mode on SCL/SDA lines.
